title: THE SÉANCE MURDERS
subtitle: Death Haunts the Parlour of Madame Zelenska
teaser: Two deaths in as many weeks at the séances of Madame Zelenska! The faithful whisper of curses and vengeful spirits—but you suspect something far more earthly. Behind the theatrical trickery lies a calculating killer with £200,000 at stake.
briefing:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

                    ❧ SPIRITS OF VENGEANCE ❧
                        
Two deaths in as many weeks at the home of MADAME ZELENSKA, the 
famed spiritualist medium whose séances have captivated high 
society!

First, the elderly BARON ASHWORTH collapsed during a summoning 
of his late wife's spirit—his heart gave out, so said the 
physician. Then, just days ago, his nephew CHARLES ASHWORTH 
fell dead at the very same table, foam upon his lips and terror 
in his eyes.

The faithful whisper of curses and vengeful spirits. The 
skeptical mutter of coincidence. But YOU suspect something 
far more earthly: murder most calculated.

The Ashworth fortune—some £200,000—now passes to the Baron's 
widowed daughter-in-law. The séance attendees include devoted 
believers and bitter skeptics alike. And Madame Zelenska's 
past is shrouded in mystery.

Penetrate the veil of deception, investigator. The spirits 
may be false, but the danger is very real.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

characters.name: Madame Zelenska
characters.description: An exotic woman of uncertain age, draped in purple velvet and silver jewelry. Her accent is vaguely Eastern European, her manner theatrical. Her dark eyes seem to see more than they should.
characters.initialDialogue:
"The spirits are... disturbed by your presence, investigator."

Madame Zelenska speaks in hushed, dramatic tones.

"I am merely a conduit between worlds. What happened to Baron Ashworth and his nephew was the work of forces beyond mortal understanding."

She gestures to the darkened parlour.

"Lady Ashworth's spirit was angry that night. She spoke of betrayal, of secrets. The Baron clutched his heart and fell. Young Charles came seeking answers... and found only death."

"I cannot control what the spirits reveal or what vengeance they seek. I am but the vessel."

conditionalDialogue.clue_stage_past:
Madame Zelenska's composure cracks.

"That was... another life. Maggie Bell died years ago. I am Madame Zelenska now."

She sighs, dropping the accent briefly.

"Yes, I was a stage magician. Yes, I know tricks—misdirection, illusion, suggestion. But I also have genuine gifts. The two are not mutually exclusive."

"I did not kill those men. My séances are theatrical, but harmless. Someone used my performance as cover for murder."
conditionalDialogue.clue_poison_purchase:
"That was not me! I have never been to that chemist!"

Zelenska's denial is fierce.

"Someone is trying to make me the scapegoat. Think about it—who benefits? Not me! If my clients die, my reputation is ruined!"

"Someone else bought that poison and described a woman like me. Ask yourself: who knew about my past as a performer? Who knew enough to frame me?"

characters.name: Victoria Ashworth
characters.description: A beautiful woman in her thirties, Victoria was married to the Baron's son Edward, who died in a hunting accident two years ago. She wears black, but her grief seems well-rehearsed.
characters.initialDialogue:
"Father Ashworth's death was a shock, of course. And poor Charles... so young."

Victoria dabs her eyes with a handkerchief.

"I tried to discourage the séances. Summoning the dead is unwholesome. But the Baron was obsessed with contacting his late wife, and Charles followed wherever his uncle led."

She looks away.

"Now I am alone in this great house. The estate falls to me—Edward's widow—as the Baron's only surviving connection to his son."

"It is a burden I never sought."

conditionalDialogue.clue_will_change:
Victoria's mask of grief slips.

"What are you implying? That I... that I killed for money?"

She composes herself.

"The Baron was going to change his will—that's true. He wanted to leave everything to Charles. But he died before he could."

"That's convenient for me, I admit. But convenience is not proof of murder. Many people had reason to want the Baron and Charles dead."
conditionalDialogue.clue_arsenic_symptoms:
"You're accusing me of poisoning them?"

Victoria rises, indignant.

"I was at those séances! I held hands with the other sitters! How could I possibly have administered poison without being seen?"

"Madame Zelenska controls everything in that room. The darkness, the candles, who sits where. If anyone poisoned them, it was her."

characters.name: Dr. James Hartley
characters.description: The Ashworth family physician for twenty years, Dr. Hartley is a portly man with mutton chops and an air of professional competence. He examined both bodies.
characters.initialDialogue:
"I certified the Baron's death as heart failure. It seemed... consistent with his age and the excitement of the séance."

Dr. Hartley shifts uncomfortably.

"But Charles? A healthy young man of thirty does not simply die of fright. When I examined him, I noticed... irregularities."

He lowers his voice.

"Constricted pupils. Excessive salivation. A bitter almond scent about the lips. These are not symptoms of a weak heart."

"I believe Charles Ashworth was poisoned. And now I wonder if the Baron was as well."

conditionalDialogue.clue_arsenic_symptoms:
"You've confirmed my suspicions then."

Dr. Hartley nods gravely.

"Arsenic. The classic poison—nearly undetectable in small doses, easily administered in food or drink."

"Madame Zelenska serves tea before her séances. It would be simple to poison a single cup. But she would need access to the poison and a motive."

"Unless... someone else prepared the tea that night."
conditionalDialogue.clue_poison_purchase:
"A woman matching Zelenska's description? Interesting, but not conclusive."

The doctor frowns.

"Theatrical costumes and wigs are easily obtained. Anyone could disguise themselves to make a purchase."

"Consider who benefits from the deaths AND from Zelenska taking the blame. That is your true murderer."

characters.name: Edgar Crane
characters.description: A sharp-eyed young journalist who has been investigating the spiritualism craze. Crane has made it his mission to expose fraudulent mediums.
characters.initialDialogue:
"Zelenska? She's a fraud, like all the rest. I've been investigating her for months."

Crane spreads newspaper clippings across his desk.

"Real name: Margaret Bell. Performed as 'The Amazing Maggie' in music halls across the north. Stage magic, mentalism, the whole routine."

He taps a faded photograph.

"She reinvented herself as Madame Zelenska five years ago. The foreign accent, the mysterious past—all fabricated."

"But is she a murderer? That I cannot say. Her tricks are designed to fleece the gullible, not kill them."

conditionalDialogue.clue_stage_past:
"So you've discovered her secret identity. Good work."

Crane leans forward eagerly.

"The question is: does this past make her a killer, or just a con artist? Stage magicians are skilled at misdirection and sleight of hand—perfect for poisoning."

"But she had no obvious motive. The Ashworths were her best clients. Their deaths hurt her business."

"Unless she was paid by someone else..."
conditionalDialogue.clue_victoria_affair:
Crane's eyes widen.

"Victoria Ashworth and the nephew? Now THAT is interesting."

He scribbles notes furiously.

"So Victoria had a motive to kill the Baron—inheritance. And Charles—to silence him about the affair."

"A widow who murders her way to a fortune. That's a story worth printing."

characters.name: Mr. Archibald Pemberton
characters.description: A precise, elderly solicitor who has handled the Ashworth family's affairs for decades. He guards their secrets jealously—most of them.
characters.initialDialogue:
"The Ashworth estate is... complicated."

Mr. Pemberton removes his spectacles and polishes them carefully.

"The Baron's will names his daughter-in-law Victoria as primary beneficiary—some £200,000 in property and investments. This was conditional on her remaining unmarried."

"However, Baron Ashworth came to me just days before his death. He wished to change the will, naming his nephew Charles as heir instead."

He sighs.

"The new will was never signed. Victoria inherits everything."

conditionalDialogue.clue_will_change:
"Yes, the timing is... suggestive."

Pemberton chooses his words carefully.

"The Baron was quite agitated when he visited. He said he had learned something disturbing about Victoria—something that made him question her worthiness as heir."

"He would not tell me what it was. Only that Charles had discovered the truth and shared it with him."

"Now both men are dead, and whatever secret they learned died with them."
conditionalDialogue.clue_victoria_affair:
Pemberton closes his eyes.

"So that was the Baron's discovery. Victoria and Charles..."

"This explains everything. The Baron learned of the affair and decided to disinherit Victoria. Charles must have felt guilty and confessed."

"Victoria had motive to kill them both—before the will could be changed, and to silence Charles forever."

characters.name: Molly Shaw
characters.description: A former stage performer now working in a music hall, Molly was 'The Amazing Maggie's' assistant years ago. She knows all the secrets of the trade.
characters.initialDialogue:
"Maggie Bell? Haven't heard that name in years."

Molly laughs, a tired sound.

"We worked together on the northern circuit. She was brilliant—best mentalist I ever saw. Could read a mark from across the room, tell them things about themselves they'd forgotten."

She shrugs.

"Then she got ambitious. Decided fake accents and séances paid better than honest stage work. Can't blame her, really."

"Is she in trouble? Maggie was many things, but never violent. Her game was always the long con—make them love you, then take their money."

conditionalDialogue.clue_stage_past:
"So she's been exposed? About time, I suppose."

Molly considers.

"Maggie's tricks relied on preparation. She'd research her clients beforehand—learn their secrets, their losses, what they wanted to hear."

"If someone died at her séance, either she's gotten sloppy... or someone used her methods against her."

"Anyone who knew her stage techniques could set her up."

characters.name: Mr. Thomas Wright
characters.description: The proprietor of a well-respected chemist's shop, Mr. Wright keeps meticulous records of all purchases—especially the dangerous ones.
characters.initialDialogue:
"I am required by law to maintain records of all poison sales."

Mr. Wright produces a leather-bound ledger.

"Let me see... arsenic purchases in the past month. Here we are."

He runs his finger down the page.

"Three days before the first death: arsenic trioxide, two ounces. Purchased by a woman—foreign accent, dark hair, purple dress."

He frowns.

"She gave the name 'Mrs. Smith' and claimed it was for rats. I had my doubts, but she had money and seemed respectable enough."

conditionalDialogue.clue_victoria_affair:
"Wait—you say the buyer might have been in disguise?"

Mr. Wright thinks carefully.

"Now you mention it, she wore heavy makeup and a veil. Claimed sensitivity to light."

"If someone wanted to impersonate Madame Zelenska to make a purchase... they could have. The accent was thick, perhaps too thick. Theatrical."

"I cannot be certain who truly bought that poison."

clues.title: Scene of Two Deaths
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ THE FATAL PARLOUR ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

The séance room is draped in dark velvet, lit only by candles. 
A round table dominates the center, surrounded by eight chairs.

Zelenska explains the ritual: clients hold hands around the 
table while she summons spirits. Tea is served beforehand.

Notably, Zelenska sits across from the door, unable to see 
who enters the room behind her during preparation. Anyone 
could slip something into a teacup.

Two men died at this table. The spirits are silent on who 
is responsible.

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Two deaths at the same séance table. Tea is served before each session. The medium sits with her back to the preparation area.

clues.title: Signs of Poisoning
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ MEDICAL EVIDENCE ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Dr. Hartley describes what he observed in Charles Ashworth's body:

    ╭─────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
    │  SYMPTOMS OBSERVED                              │
    │                                                 │
    │  - Constricted pupils                           │
    │  - Excessive salivation                         │
    │  - Bitter almond scent on lips                  │
    │  - Gastric distress (pre-mortem)                │
    │  - Rapid onset of symptoms                      │
    ╰─────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

"These are classic signs of arsenic poisoning. I suspect the 
Baron's death was the same, but I did not examine him as 
carefully. Someone poisoned these men."

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Dr. Hartley confirms Charles showed classic arsenic poisoning symptoms. The Baron likely died the same way.

clues.title: The Unsigned Will
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ LEGAL MATTERS ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Mr. Pemberton reveals critical information about the Ashworth will:

"Baron Ashworth came to me days before his death. He wished 
to change his will entirely—removing Victoria as beneficiary 
and naming his nephew Charles instead."

    Current Will: Victoria Ashworth - £200,000
    Proposed Will: Charles Ashworth - £200,000
    
    STATUS: Proposed will NEVER SIGNED
    
    RESULT: Victoria inherits everything

"The Baron said he had learned something disturbing about 
Victoria. Now he and Charles are dead, and she inherits all."

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Baron planned to disinherit Victoria and leave everything to Charles. He died before signing. Victoria inherits £200,000.

clues.title: The Medium Unmasked
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ A HIDDEN HISTORY ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Edgar Crane produces evidence of Zelenska's past:

    ╭─────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
    │  THE AMAZING MAGGIE - Music Hall Performer      │
    │                                                 │
    │  Real Name: Margaret Bell                       │
    │  Born: Manchester, 1845                         │
    │  Career: Stage mentalist, illusionist           │
    │  Active: Northern circuit, 1865-1880            │
    │                                                 │
    │  "Reinvented" as Madame Zelenska, 1881          │
    ╰─────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

"She's a fraud—a skilled one, but a fraud nonetheless. Her 
séances are elaborate stage shows, not genuine spirit contact."

But does being a fraud make her a murderer?

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Madame Zelenska is actually Margaret Bell, a former stage magician. Her séances are elaborate performances, not genuine.

clues.title: The Arsenic Purchase
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ POISON REGISTER ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Mr. Wright's meticulous records reveal a purchase:

    ╭─────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
    │  ARSENIC SALE - CONFIDENTIAL                    │
    │                                                 │
    │  Date: Three days before Baron's death          │
    │  Substance: Arsenic trioxide, 2 oz              │
    │  Purchaser: "Mrs. Smith"                        │
    │  Description: Foreign accent, dark hair,        │
    │               purple dress, heavy veil          │
    │  Stated Purpose: Rat poison                     │
    ╰─────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

The description matches Madame Zelenska perfectly. But the 
chemist notes the accent seemed "too theatrical" and the 
buyer wore heavy makeup and a veil.

Was it truly Zelenska—or someone impersonating her?

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Arsenic purchased days before the first death by a woman matching Zelenska's description—but possibly in disguise.

clues.title: The Scandalous Secret
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ SOCIETY WHISPERS ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

At the gentleman's club, you overhear gossip about the Ashworths:

"Everyone knows about Victoria and young Charles. Started 
before Edward even died—some say that hunting 'accident' was 
no accident at all."

Another member chimes in:

"The Baron discovered the affair just before he died. His 
valet said he was furious—called Victoria a 'serpent' and 
swore to cut her off without a penny."

"And now both the Baron and Charles are dead. Convenient, 
wouldn't you say?"

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Victoria was having an affair with Charles. The Baron discovered this and planned to disinherit her. Both men who knew are now dead.

clues.title: The Art of Disguise
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ THEATRICAL KNOWLEDGE ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Molly Shaw reveals insider knowledge:

"Maggie's act relied on preparation—knowing her marks before 
they walked in. Anyone who knew her methods could use them."

She demonstrates with makeup and a wig from the costume room.

"See? Takes five minutes to transform. The right dress, the 
right accent, and anyone could pass for Zelenska at a chemist's 
shop."

"If someone wanted to frame her for murder, they could have 
bought the poison in disguise and made sure witnesses described 
someone matching Madame Zelenska."

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Stage performers can easily disguise themselves. Someone could have impersonated Zelenska to buy the poison and frame her.

clues.title: Victoria's Defense
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ THE WIDOW PROTESTS ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Victoria Ashworth attempts to deflect suspicion:

"Yes, I inherit the fortune. Yes, the Baron was going to 
change his will. Yes, I was at both séances."

She meets your gaze defiantly.

"But think logically. I held hands with the other sitters 
during the séance. I could not have slipped poison into 
anyone's cup without being seen."

"Madame Zelenska controls everything in that room. She serves 
the tea. She decides where people sit. She dims the lights."

"If you want a murderer, look to her."

A clever defense—but perhaps too clever?

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Victoria claims she couldn't have poisoned anyone because she held hands during the séance. She blames Zelenska—but her alibi feels rehearsed.

clues.title: A Fresh Grave Disturbed
clues.discoveryText:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
                        ❧ AMONG THE DEAD ❧
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

At Lady Ashworth's grave, you notice something peculiar:

Fresh footprints in the mud, too small for a man's boot. 
Royal purple thread caught on the iron railing—fabric from 
an expensive dress.

Nearby, half-buried in leaves, a small bottle labeled 
"Arsenic - Poison" with traces of white powder inside.

Someone came here recently to dispose of evidence. The 
purple thread matches fabric favored by Madame Zelenska... 
or by someone wishing to implicate her.

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
clues.notebookSummary: Empty poison bottle found near Lady Ashworth's grave, along with purple thread. Someone disposed of evidence here.

solution.motive:
GREED, SECRETS, AND SURVIVAL

Victoria Ashworth's carefully constructed life was about to collapse.

Her affair with Charles had been discovered by Baron Ashworth, who 
swore to disinherit her immediately. Worse, Charles—overcome with 
guilt—planned to confess everything publicly.

Facing the loss of £200,000 and social ruin, Victoria chose murder.

She killed the Baron first, using poison slipped into his tea before 
the séance. When Charles threatened to expose her, he too had to die. 
She bought the arsenic while disguised as Madame Zelenska, ensuring 
the medium would take the blame.

Two murders. One fortune. And a spiritualist to hang for it.
solution.method:
Victoria exploited her knowledge of Zelenska's theatrical past to 
create the perfect frame.

She purchased arsenic while disguised as the medium—foreign accent, 
purple dress, heavy veil. She slipped the poison into the Baron's 
tea before the séance, using the dimmed lights and ritual hand-holding 
to establish her 'alibi.'

Charles died the same way a week later—poisoned tea, another séance, 
another 'supernatural' death.

Victoria disposed of the poison bottle at Lady Ashworth's grave, 
trusting that no one would look there. She nearly got away with it.
